Solve the puzzles correctly to escape. Get them wrong, and you will find yourself further and further along the path to your own demise.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cute Animals on Fire: Super Art Fight's Party Game of Drawing Destruction
Description:
Based on the equally ridiculous Super Art Fight live show, this hilarious party game for artists of all skill levels has players create drawings based upon classic Art Fight topics like MASHUP SUPER HEROES, AWKWARD TEEN MONSTERS, or MAJESTIC FACIAL HAIR.

The Ref chooses a topic. Everyone else draws that topic. They present the results, and the Ref chooses a winner.

So do your best to out-think and out-draw your opponents, but be prepared... it's gonna get stupid.

—description from the designer

Name: No Context
Description:
"How well do you know your friends?"

Pick someone you think you know well. Randomly pick a card from the deck and read it aloud (doesn't matter who). From the choices on the card, write down your choice under the "Me" column and write down what you think your teammate wrote down under the "Not Me" column. Repeat for all 8 question cards in the round. Once you're done with the round, compare answers question-by-question, team-by-team. If you and your teammate pick correctly for each other (you get theirs right and they get yours right), you get 1 team point. Anything else is 0 points. The team with the total number of team points after all 3 rounds wins the game.

There are two main additional ways to play: Party Mode and 1-on-1. For Party Mode, one person reads each question out loud and people shout out what they would choose. Then everyone argues about why they're right and everyone else is wrong. For 1-on-1, you and that someone you think you know well are the only team playing. Which one of you knows the other person better?

—description from the designer

Name: Blank It
Description:
Blank It is a fill-in-the-blank game that presents you with incomplete comedic "poems." Players must decide which word cards on the table best fit in the blanks of poems in categories like “Roses Are Red” and “Haiku.” How racy the poems get depends on the crowd you’re playing with, and how they view words like “balls” and “pork"!

—description from the publisher

Name: Las Pruebas Mágicas del Atelier of Witch Hat
Description:
Limited edition version of Love Letter with variable player powers and alternate victory conditions. Art by Kamome Shirahama.

The players are apprentices dedicated to magic learning, to bring happiness to people. Each player has a hand of magic actions ( that represent the spells they know at the moment). On your turn, draw a card from the deck and discard one of the 2 cards in your hand. They played card will have an effect that will help you.
The apprentices still don't know many spells, so you'll have to choose the most apropiate card in each situation. Also, if you deduce the other player's cards, you'll be able to create opportunities to eliminate them (making them lose time with their studies).
If all players except one are eliminated, that one wins. If the deck of cards runs out, the player with the highest value card in hand wins.

Content:
Magic cards (16) 
Character cards (5)
Mission cards (8)
Quick reference cards (4)
Instruction manual

Name: National Economy Glory
Description:
National Economy Glory is the second independent additional set of macro economy game National economy. You can play alone as opposed to the expanded version. The entire building card has been renewed and it has become a completely new playing environment.

The diversity of the strategy has been greatly increased by the new element "machine doll" and the sleeping "remains" of super technology.

Name: Roll for Adventure: Abtrünniger Promoheld
Description:
A promo hero for the game Roll for Adventure.

Jedes Mal nachdem der Gebietswürfel geworfen wurde, darfst du einmal das Ergebnis ablehnen und den Würfel erneut werfen. Es gilt dann das neue Ergebnis.

("Each time the territory die is rolled, you may ignore the first result and reroll the die. The new result stands.")

Name: The trouble with men: the game that exposes male behaviour!
Description:
This game poses classic sexist questions and asks you to predict the results.
What annoys you most about men..?
That they are selfish?
That they are lazy?
That they are unable to do more than one thing at a time?
Well this game is designed to put men on the spot to show them in their true colours and shame them into changing their ways.
Whatever happens it will reveal the dark conniving condescending crude and sexist side of the male character.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Trivia for kids
Description:
1800 questions on art,science, tv, movies, history, famous people, super heroes, comics and music.

—description from the side of the box

Name: Give us a  break:  radio 1's popular quiz game
Description:
Give us a break contains 392 cards in 7 packs and a white die. There are three packs of red questions, the remaining four packs contain the other 6 colours.  Red questions are easiest and score 1 point if correctly answered.  The scores for the other cards are yellow 2 green 3 brown 4 blue 5 pink 6 and black 7.
Place the cards questions up in seven piles corresponding to their colours Players may read the questions on the top card of any pack at any time but must not remove the card from its pack to read the answers.
To start all the players roll the die and the highest roller goes first.  He must play a red card followed by a colour of his choice followed by another red card etc and can continue playing until he gets a question wrong.  With each turn, the rules of snooker apply ie. after playing and answering correctly questions on 15 red cards and the following card of his choice the player must then answer one question each from yellow green brown blue pink and black packet in that order.
Before playing a card of the colour chosen the player rolls the die which determines which question on the card he must attempt to answer.  The person on the players right checks the answer and places the card question up on the bottom of the pack.  The person on the players left keeps the players score.  When the player fails to answer a question correctly play passes to the left.  The first player to finish his turn with an exact score of 147 is the winner if after his final score turn a players score totals over 147 he must retire.

—description from the back of the box

Name: TVS Catch Phrase
Description:
Based on the popular T.V.S. television programme.  Catchphrase drawings have nine boards placed in front of them and players roll the die to determine which board is removed to reveal part of the picture.  If you guess the Catchphrase when only a few boards have been removed you score extra bonus points- but beware, wrong guesses give points to your opponents

—description from the back of the box

Name: Santa's Magic Christmas Game
Description:
Christmas is coming so join in the fun with Santa's Magic Christmas.  The only game to play on Christmas eve.  It's fun for all the family 
Become one of Santa's Reindeer and join in the race around Santa's Grotto where his helpers are making Christmas presents.
But beware of Santa squares or else you may end up singing Jingle bells or telling a bad joke or worse- listening to someone else telling a joke

—description from the back of the box

Name: Forfitz
Description:
The ultimate game of dares with sticky notes and sticky situations.
Why ultimate because you make them up as you go along.  You can be as kind funny wicked sly sarcastic or rude as you like
It's simple land on an empty space and you get to write a forfit, and a points value on a sticky and attach it to that space.
Buuut land on a space with a sticky note on it and you have to do exactly what the note says to collect the sticky note and the points
Refuse to do the forfeit or fail and a sticky note goes to the centre where everyone has a chance to grab it.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Dogma: A clash of religions
Description:
Create your religion! The greatest prophets of all times: man and women of exceptional charisma that made history with their ideas, come back to life to spread their cult. In Dogma: A Clash of Religions, you'll have to exploit their skills and powers to defeat your opponent and create your own religion.

The players will create a number of mini-decks by drafting from a common pool of boosters. Each mini-deck will have exactly 1 prophet and 3 support cards. The support cards can be cult abilities or relics. The players will then face each other in a battle where the active Prophet will use his cards to try to destroy the opposing Prophet, and can call for help from the other prophets in his army. Each prophet has a Faith value, representing how much damage he can endure. When their Faith reaches zero, the prophet is dead.

Name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Das Rätsel der blutigen Schere
Description:
Paris, 1965. The glamorous world of fashion also has its downsides. Henri Flanelle, the world-famous fashion designer and inventor of the short sheath dress, is found dead - stabbed to death with heavy tailor's scissors. And this one day before the presentation of his latest collection!

Only eight people from his inner circle can be considered suspects. And they all have something to hide. It quickly becomes apparent that behind the dazzling façade of the fashion empire by no means everything is as it seems ...
